intro: Shawia pinifolia, commonly known as the pineleaf shawia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its narrow, needle-like leaves that resemble pine needles. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with pale greenish or white flowers, which are adapted to pollination by wind. Shawia pinifolia thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an important species in its native habitat.
